The claim is supported by a lengthy Thai: language caption that states bitter melon has cancer prevention properties and can effectively cure cancer. It also mentions that bitter melon extract only destroys cancer cells and not healthy cells.
Similar claims about bitter melon and it: curing properties have been shared online in the past, including on Facebook, Twitter, and health information websites.
Medical experts: including Thailand's National Cancer Institute and the Sure and Share Centre (a Thai fact-checking organization), have debunked the claim and stated that bitter melon is not an effective treatment or cure for cancer.
